pages.text: Let's first learn how to create a simple buff spell that can give us a speed boost and a sense of urgency. First, we need to gather $(#20B2AA)an Arc Element Core, gunpowder, several sticks, several lapis lazuli, and several redstone$(). $(br2)The Arc Element Core is cultivated and synthesized using crystals from the Arc Element, which is commonly found on Creepers. Additionally, we need to synthesize a $(#0000FF)Function$() Spell Core at the Magick Synthesis Matrix.

First, we need to throw the sticks onto the Synthesis Matrix to transform them into Spirit Sticks, and then use the Spirit Sticks to craft a Wand. Spirit Sticks are the raw material for creating wand, and we frequently use wand in the process.

Next, we need to right-click and place these materials on the Magick Synthesis Matrix. The materials required are Spirit Sticks and Spirit Crystals, arranged in a 2x2 grid. Once the materials are placed, use the wand to right-click on them to obtain a $(#0000FF)Function$() Spell Core.

pages.title: Function Spell Core
pages.text: The $(#0000FF)Function Spell Core$() is a container for storing mana materials and is specifically used for crafting $(#0000FF)functional spells$(). We can throw the $(#0000FF)Function Spell Core$() on the ground, and it will rise a few blocks and unfold. $(br2)For $(#0000FF)functional spells$(), we need to throw elemental cores, $(#0000FF)application types$() materials, and other mana materials into the Function Spell Core in the form of dropped items. This will determine the $(#0000FF)function$(), $(#00CED1)force$(), $(#FFB90F)duration$(), and $(#EE6363)range$() attributes of the $(#0000FF)functional spell$().

pages.title: Unfolded Function Spell Core
pages.text: The unfolded $(#0000FF)Function Spell Core$() contains the materials. We can use $(#0000FF)right-click$() on the Function Spell Core to retrieve the materials or use $(#0000FF)three consecutive clicks$() on the Function Spell Core to retrieve the $(#0000FF)Function Spell Core$() itself.

The materials we have collected so far are: $(#20B2AA)Arc Element Core, gunpowder, lapis lazuli, redstone$(). The latter three need to be thrown into the Magick Synthesis Matrix to be transformed into: Mana Gunpowder, $(#00CED1)Force$() Mana Energy, and $(#FFB90F)Duration$() Mana Energy. $(br2)Mana Gunpowder is used to change the $(#0000FF)application type$() of the element, or in other words, the state of the mana element. When combined with the Arc Element, it forms Arc Buff, which has the effect of grants creature haste. $(br2)It is important to note that the Spell Core has attribute limits, and once the limit is reached, no more mana energy can be added.

Mana energy corresponds to the three basic attributes of $(#0000FF)function$(): $(#00CED1)force$(), $(#EE6363)range$(), and $(#FFB90F)duration$(). For buff magic, we usually only need to increase $(#00CED1)force$() and $(#FFB90F)duration$(), which is why we need to collect lapis lazuli and redstone. $(br2)We throw the $(#20B2AA)Arc Element Core, Mana Gunpowder, and the two types of mana energy$() into the unfolded $(#0000FF)function$() Spell Core as dropped items to create a magic spell that can grants creature haste. $(br2)Finally, right-click on the unfolded spell construction with the wand to compress it into a Molding Spell. It is important to note that $(#B22222)once the Spell Core becomes a Molding Spell, it cannot be modified$().
